cupcake physics

    July 5th, 2015

    New Icons for Difficulty and Subject Area

    New Icons!

    You may have noticed that the blog has gotten more colorful! I have rolled out a set of icons that you can use to quickly identify the difficulty and content of each blog post.

    ####Difficulty Levels

    Icon Difficulty Description
    Easy These posts cover introductory physics topics seen in an upper-level high school or lower-level college course. Depending on the post, you might see a few lines of basic calculus.
    Medium These posts cover intermediate physics topics that are usually seen by undergraduate physics majors. They include longer derivations and more sophisticated math techniques.
    Hard These posts cover advanced physics topics that are seen by upper-level undergraduate students and graduate students in physics. This is where I cover some of the difficult theory that physicists have to contend with.

    Subject Areas

    Icon Subject Area Sample Topics
    Classical Mechanics Newton's Laws, Orbital Mechanics, Lagrangian Mechanics, Hamiltonian Mechanics, Continuum Mechanics, Kinematics, Statics, Dynamics, Classical Chaos Theory, Acoustics, Fluid Dynamics
    Computational Physics Numerical Methods, Scientific Visualization, Computer Simulations, Compputing Libraries, Software Development, Approximation Methods, Models, Software and Hardware Structure
    Electromagnetism Electrostatics, Electrodynamics, Magnetostatics, Magnetodynamics, Maxwell's Equations, Circuits, Vector Calculus
    Math Methods Geometry, Algebra, Geometry, Calculus, Differential Equations, Eigenvalue Problems, Vector Spaces, Group Theory, Set Theory, Probability and Statistics, Complex Numbers, Special Functions
    Optics Light, Geometric Optics, Lenses, Mirrors, Beam Splitters, Power, Intensity, Photonics, Interference, Phasors
    Quantum Field Theory Action Principle, Canonical Quantization, Applied Group Theory, Path Integrals, Loop Corrections, Propagators, Lorentz Invariant Systems, Renormalization, Non-Abelian Symmetries, Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking, CPT Violations
    Quantum Mechanics Schrodinger Equation, Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle, Operators, Bra-Ket Notation, Hydrogenic Atoms, Commutation Relations, Spin Systems, Wave-Particle Duality, Quantum Harmonic Oscillator
    Relativity Lorentz Factor, Relativistic Doppler Shift, Equivalence Principle, Time Dilation, Length Contraction, Relativistic Paradoxes, Special Relativity, General Relativity
    Thermodynamics and Statistical Physics Heat, Work, Efficiency, Entropy, Enthalpy, Temperature, Fermi-Dirac Statistics, Bose-Einstein Statistics, Maxwell-Boltzmann Statistics, Phase Changes, Diffusion, Random Walks

    ####Cupcake Physics News

    Just to keep announcements clear, I will use the following pink icon to identify Cupcake Physics news and updates.

    Next week, we will get back to physics. See you then!
